archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Gochujang Pork Shoulder Burritos with Jalapeño Chimichurri, Corn-Black Bean Rice, and Quick Cucumber Pickles
description: Spicy grilled pork shoulder wrapped in warm tortillas with corn–black bean rice, jalapeño-lime chimichurri, and crisp cucumber pickles. A Korean–Latin mashup built from scratch with bold heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain.
Thinly slice 700 g pork shoulder against the grain.
Make marinade: in a bowl, mix gochujang, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, minced garlic, and sesame oil; add pork and toss. Marinate 15–20 minutes.
Quick pickles: thinly slice 1 cucumber; toss with rice vinegar, a pinch of sugar, and salt. Set aside.
Drain and rinse black beans. Chop coriander (leaves and tender stems). Mince 1–2 jalapenos. Cut 1 lime into wedges and squeeze 2 tbsp juice.
Stir jalapenos and lime juice into chimichurri; set aside.
If using grill, preheat outdoor grill to high. If using stovetop, preheat a large cast-iron pan over high and a second pan over medium for rice mix.
Warm tortilla wraps briefly to soften (microwave 10–15 sec or rest near warm stovetop).
cook_steps: Cook rice: combine rinsed jasmine rice with 2 cups water and a pinch of salt in a pot; bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes. Rest 5 minutes, fluff.

Make corn–bean mix: heat 1 tbsp avocado oil in a pan over medium-high; add corn and cook until lightly charred, 3–4 minutes. Add black beans, a pinch of cumin, salt, and black pepper; toss 2 minutes. Fold in half of the chopped coriander. Hold warm.

Grill or sear pork: lightly oil grill grates or hot pan. Shake excess marinade and cook pork in a single layer, 2–3 minutes per side, until caramelized and cooked through. Work in batches to avoid steaming. Transfer to a board and rest 2 minutes.
Taste jalapeño chimichurri and adjust salt or lime.
Assemble burritos: lay out tortilla wraps. Add a line of rice, spoon corn–bean mix, top with pork slices, drizzle jalapeño chimichurri, and add drained cucumber pickles. Sprinkle remaining coriander.
Roll burritos tightly, tucking in sides. Optional: place seam-side down on the hot pan or grill 30–60 seconds to seal.
Serve hot with extra chimichurri and lime wedges.
